page.title: 19CHANGES IN THE USE OF FARMS
page.content: Historically the farms were far more productive than they appear to be at present. In our block we found evidence of an underground storage area that was used for the keeping of grain crops, grown on the moors. There were fruit trees now long past their fruiting days but evidence of much greater fertility than would seem obvious from a visit today. Many of the farms in our block do not grow crops, save grass for the livestock. Hey House Farm_ Sheep was dairy Marsh Farm_Only a few horses Cherry Clough Farm_ Sheep Edge Gate Farm_ No animals Ogden Edge Farm_ Sheep Cherry Top_ No animals
